SEARCH

Class StatsLibrary

java.lang.Object
StatsLibrary
public class StatsLibrary extends Object
StatsLibrary provides basic statistical and probability methods. You can use it to calculate averages, find modes, and do other common statistical operations on lists of numbers.

  • Constructor Summary

      public BigInteger permutation(int n, int r)
      Calculates the number of ways to arrange a selection of items in order (permutation).
      Parameters:

      r - Number of items to arrange.
      Returns:

    • combination

      public BigInteger combination(int n, int r)
      Calculates the number of ways to choose a group of items without regard to order (combination).
      Parameters:
      n - Total number of items to choose from.
      r - Number of items to choose.
      Returns:
      The number of combinations.

    • conditionalProbability

      public double conditionalProbability(Set<Integer> eventA, Set<Integer> eventB)
      Finds the probability of Event A happening given that Event B has already happened.
      Parameters:
      eventA - The set of outcomes for Event A.
      eventB - The set of outcomes for Event B.
      Returns:
      The conditional probability of Event A given Event B.

    • geometricDistribution

      public double geometricDistribution(int trial, double successProbability)
      Calculates the probability of the first success occurring on a certain trial using geometric probability.
      Parameters:
      trial - The trial number on which the first success occurs.
      successProbability - The probability of success on each trial.
      Returns:
      The probability of the first success on the specified trial.
